website_summaries.verdict: The BenQ MW523 business projector is light enough to carry easily, at 5.1 pounds, and it offers a bright, high quality data image with a WXGA (1,280 by 800) native resolution.
pros: Lamp rated at up to 10,000 hours

customer_reviews.title: It has a great picture and my customers love coming to
customer_reviews.text: I bought this projector for my business, a hookah lounge. Needing something of quality yet budget friendly, I decided to give this projector a try. I am thoroughly impressed with what this has to offer. It has a great picture and my customers love coming to watch hockey and other sporting events on it. The picture is awesome and clear. I am showing it in a semi-low-light space, but still with ambient light and multiple windows this item shines through. My screen is 84 inches wide and not sure how tall, but if I had more wall space this thing could fill it. It makes me regret buying my 47 inch tv for a hundred bucks more.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: and it's still running great. WITH the original lamp
customer_reviews.text: For the price you can't beat the quality and features. I do wish the screen-size adjustment were more flexible so I could have an easier time placing the projector where I wanted. Over a year later, and it's still running great. WITH the original lamp!
customer_reviews.author: MIncata

customer_reviews.title: Great home theatre projector for the cost!
customer_reviews.text: A very solid price-point projector. We have owned this between six people for about 4 months now, and it has never failed to meet any expectations. 1080p is awesome! We have it at about a 11' distance from a white painted wall, and it makes avery nice 100" screen. Still visible with sunlight coming through 3 windows, but much nicer when it's dark out. Cheers!
customer_reviews.author: Colin Landeck

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product. I have been using it for almost ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. I have been using it for almost a year now, picture quality and projection aspect ration are commendable. 3D experience is a good feel. Audio output from BenQ when connected through HDMI from my laptop has little low volume with external sound system. I am not sure if it requires compatible audio speakers. Otherwise the product is worth for your penny spent.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great picture quality for the money
customer_reviews.text: Great picture quality for the money. Mine does seem to have a fan issue that causes a singing hum once it gets going. That's fine in a large room, but not so much in a small conference room.
customer_reviews.author: J. Fick

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Amazing! I don't need to go to the movies any more.
customer_reviews.author: LEANDRO LUIZ

customer_reviews.title: Very nice projector! It is bright is a well lit ...
customer_reviews.text: Very nice projector! It is bright is a well lit room and performed as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Barry Cosme

customer_reviews.title: We have a throw of about 15 foot and could not be happier with the picture
customer_reviews.text: We knew that sound was not its strong point, but that does not matter. We have a throw of about 15 foot and could not be happier with the picture.
customer_reviews.author: Briggs

customer_reviews.title: Remotes kinda cheap but projectors do a great job.
customer_reviews.text: Everybody loves them. Remotes kinda cheap but projectors do a great job.
customer_reviews.author: Soundman1

customer_reviews.title: It works great and is plenty bright
customer_reviews.text: We are loving "Movie Night" with our projector! It works great and is plenty bright!
customer_reviews.author: Donna Howley

customer_reviews.title: Great picture and loved the price
customer_reviews.text: Great picture and loved the price. FYI - don't use longer than a 25 ft cable to connect to your receiver. I did, and it didn't get a strong enough signal to show the picture for my DVD player or wii.
customer_reviews.author: AmyE

customer_reviews.title: great projector needs paper manual
customer_reviews.text: The projector proforms very well with a very good picture... I cant fault it... I have it for my home theater . Delivery was very good also. I highly recommened this projector it has brought and my old dvds back to life. I get roughly a 9ft screen from a projected distance of about 11 ft. Only thing im having trouble with is my 3d dvd recognizing the 3 d projector thru my amp using hdmi cable.. o also a paper manual would be handy not a cd
customer_reviews.author: mark

product_meta.title: BenQ MW523 WXGA 3000 Lumen 3D 10K Hour Lamp Life DLP Projector
product_meta.description:
The perfect choice to deliver stunning images and lower total cost of ownership.View larger Lorem ipsum dolor sitView larger THE BEST VALUE PROJECTOR FOR A SMALL TO MEDIUM SPACE
Featuring a WXGA resolution, a brightness of 3000 ANSI lumens, a contrast ratio of 13000:1, and an unbelievable lamp life of up to 10,000 hours, the MW523 is the perfect projector choice for your everyday life. Whether it's in business, education, or at home, the MW523 delivers stunning images and lower total cost of ownership.

SMARTECO LAMP SAVING TECHNOLOGY
Incorporating BenQ's renowned SmartEco Lamp Saving Technology, the MW523 not only offers greater energy savings to you, but continues to deliver amazing picture quality through this innovative technology. The SmartEco mode is designed to use only the exact amount of lamp power a projector needs to deliver the best contrast performance. With this feature, schools get to provide students and teachers uncompromising projection quality and reduce the total cost of ownership by extending the lamp life and lowering power consumption.

SMARTECO LAMP CARE MODE
Within the SmartEco Lamp Saving Technology umbrella, Lamp Care mode takes your dollars further by offering an astonishing lamp life of up to 10,000 hours.

NO SOURCE DETECTED FEATURE
There will be times when a projector is turned on without a display source, such as a classroom PC or notebook. To avoid a projector from running with full lamp power, BenQ created the No Source Detected feature to lower the projector lamp brightness to 30% after the projector has remained unconnected to a display source for more than three minutes. When inactive, the MW523 keeps power consumption to a minimum of 0.5W standby power, further lowering your total cost of ownership.

SPECIFICATIONS
 * Projection System: DLP 
 * Native Resolution: WXGA (1280 x 800) 
 * Brightness: 3000AL 
 * Contrast Ratio: 13000:1 
 * Display Color: 1.07 Billion Colors 
 * Lens: F=2.55-3.06, f=21-25.6mm 
 * Aspect Ratio: Native 16:10 (5 aspect ratio selectable) 
 * Image Size (Diagonal): 39"-300" 
 * Lamp Type: 190W 
 * Speaker Type: 1 x 2 watts 
 * Inputs: D-sub 15pin, RCA, S-Video, HDMI, 3.5mm audio, USB, RS232 
 * Outputs: D-sub 15-pin, HDMI, 3.mm audio

3D BLU-RAY READY PROJECTION
The MW523 is equipped with 3D Blu-ray ready projection technology to bring you the same amazing 3D effects you get in 3D movies. Offered for no added cost, the 3D feature on 3D Blu-ray ready BenQ projectors gives your audience an immersive real-life experience. Get ready to experience 3D like you've never seen it before.
